intro: Sphaeralcea brevipes, commonly known as the shortfoot globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its low-growing, sprawling habit and is often found in rocky soils and arid environments. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are small, hairy, and typically arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. Sphaeralcea brevipes is adapted to drought conditions and is an important component of desert ecosystems.
